title: Add to Longs on AT&T's Upside Breakout
text:
AT&T (T) has broken out on the upside so now is the time to add to longs.

In this daily bar chart of T, below, we can see that prices have been trading sideways for nearly two months and it looks, at least to me, that prices are breaking out on the upside of this small consolidation pattern. T is trading above the rising 50-day moving average line and the bullish 200-day line.

The daily On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has been climbing higher the past 12 months telling us that buyers of T have been more aggressive.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator has been above the zero line in bullish territory since June and now it is turning to the upside again for a fresh outright buy signal.

In this weekly bar chart of T, below, we can see that prices are above the rising 40-week moving average line.

The weekly OBV line has been moving up strong the past year and the MACD oscillator is bullish.

In this Point and Figure chart of T, below, we can see the recent price breakout and a new longer-term price target of $60.

Bottom line strategy: Traders could go long T here or add to existing longs here. Risk to $36 now with $60 as our longer-term price target.
description: Let's drill down on the charts and indicators....T
authors: Add To Longs On At T'S Upside Breakout
Let'S Drill Down On The Charts
